page.title: 01FLODIGARRY VILLAGE
page.content: FLODIGARRY VILLAGE AND ENVIRONS The area has a mountain ridge with foothills and flat moorland leading to the sea. There is a stretch of cliff in the northern section. The crofting village, called Flodigarry, one larger and a smaller part half-a-mile furthersouth, is grouped on a slope facing the sea. there is a large land-slip which just clears the village. The ground is sub -siding from the moorland to the sea. Overlooking the village is the Hotel and its annexe facing south-east. The fourteen inhabited houses are all detached mostly white-washed, two-storey, traditional buildings facing the sea. The newer houses are bungalow-styled but blend well with the others. The views of hills, sea, mountain and moorland are very beautiful.
